Line 20: Line 20:
In Ubuntu, the Update Manager is used to update the operating system to new versions which are released every six months for standard releases or every two years for Long Term Support releases. This functionality is included by default in the desktop version but needs to be added to the server version.<ref name="Upgrade">[https://help.ubuntu.com/community/LucidUpgrades LucidUpgrade].</ref>
In Ubuntu, the Update Manager is used to update the operating system to new versions which are released every six months for standard releases or every two years for Long Term Support releases. This functionality is included by default in the desktop version but needs to be added to the server version.<ref name="Upgrade">[https://help.ubuntu.com/community/LucidUpgrades LucidUpgrade].</ref>
â
Update Manager is subject to [[Canonical's contributor agreement]], requiring contributors to assign copyright to Canonical, and allowing Canonical to release it under a different license, including the possibility of a non-[[open-source license]].<ref name="main">{{cite web | url = http://www.canonical.com/contributors | accessdate = 2010-12-31 | title = Canonical's contributor agreement}}</ref>
+
Update Manager is subject to [[Canonical's contributor agreement]], requiring contributors to assign copyright to Canonical.<ref name="main">{{cite web | url = http://www.canonical.com/contributors | accessdate = 2010-12-31 | title = Canonical's contributor agreement}}</ref>
